intro: Scurrula steenisii, commonly known as the Cape goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It has slender, branching stems and small, linear leaves. Scurrula steenisii is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant color and drought-resistant nature.
